page.title: 12HOLKHAM ESTATE
page.content:
Holkham Estate has fourteen miles of roadways. The wall around the part is nine miles long and was built in 1833 and finished in 1839.
Crops: there are 215 acres of sugar beet, 5 acres of fodder beet, 150 acres of wheat, 250 acres of barley and 263 acres of spring barley.
Animals: (1985) 1150 Lambs. Â£3.00 per head is made on shearing wool. Some sheep are sold for meat at the local butcher. There are 60 cows.
Workers:
Woodland department - 8 full-time Building department - 8 full-time Farming department - 8 full-time including a mechanic.
